other_tests.findings: Score of 5 out of 15, indicating depressive symptoms.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At the 6-week follow-up, the Geriatric Depression Scale score improved to 3 out of 15.

other_tests.findings: Initial MMSE score showed cognitive impairments with specific difficulties in delayed recall and reversals.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At the 6-week follow-up, the MMSE score improved to 26 out of 30 with fewer errors.

other_tests.findings: Clock drawing was performed with slight malposition of hour hand, requiring more effort than expected.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At the 6-week follow-up, the patient made no errors in clock drawing.

other_tests.findings: Mild atrophy consistent with age, periventricular white-matter hyperintensities, and one lacuna in the centrum semiovale.
